title: Epitaph for Sosia Elate
support: Marble cinerary urn without lid (lost after discovery), on sides simple palmettes and ram protomi.

handNote.lettering: Regular letters: lunate Ε, Σ, cursive Μ. Φ with an extended upright and Υ at l. 4 with extended slanted bars.

date._: Second half of 1st century — first half of 2nd century CE

provenanceFound._: Found c. 1624 in “vinea la Mura”, a vineyard close to the city wall.

provenanceObserved._: Observed by Walther “in Foro Merceri seu Mercati-Lunae, apud Vinc. Maioranam”, in the wall of the Loggia by Carrera, in Museo Biscari by Torremuzza and Kaibel, later by Korhonen in magazzino superiore, Collezione Biscari, formerly sala IX 24.

graphics.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana

location.address: Castello Ursino, Piazza Federico II di Svevia, 95121 Catania (CT)
